column1: Narrator : In the middle of an immense field stands an old mansion. It’s in a very poor state and looks abandoned.

column11: Narrator : An old lady opens the door.

column8: Narrator : After a few seconds, the door opens wide.
Narrator : But there is no one inside.

column11: OtherSpeak : Please come on in, and follow me to the living room!

column5: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have the key…
column7: PlayerSpeak : Ouch... I think me leg will break before the door...

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE opens the door but it’s too dark to see anything.

column3: PlayerSpeak : If only I had a lantern…

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE stands in the entryway of a stately mansion.
column5: Narrator : CAPITAINE is in a coquettish house. It looks like a boudoir is at the end of the hall. There is the dining room to the left.

column1: Narrator : A hallway leads into what looks like the living room. On the left is the kitchen. A beautiful staircase leads upstairs.
Narrator : The living room is really fancy and comfy. There is a big mess on a wooden table.
column3: Narrator : CAPITAINE enters into a warm and cosy living room. It looks empty, but the fireplace is still lit.
Narrator : Against the wall, there is a messy desk with papers and books scattered all over and around it.
column8: PlayerSpeak : Nothing interesting to find here...

column6: PlayerSpeak : Only letters in gibberish and shopping lists...
column7: PlayerSpeak : Maps, with NOMTRESOR written all other it!

column6: Narrator : The desk is filled with research on the topic of NOMTRESOR
Narrator : There’s only strange calculations, ancient alphabets and silly quotes from mad seamen.
Narrator : But the word FORMULA seems to come up in almost every page.

column3: OtherSpeak : Attacking an old lady? How dare you!

column2: Choice : Do you know about NOMTRESOR?
column4: Choice : You woudn’t have something to eat? (trade)
column8: Choice : How are things ‘round these parts? (quest)

column2: OtherSpeak : Sorry dear, never heard about it!
column3: OtherSpeak : My husband was obsessed with this legend. He left saying he would head DIRECTIONTOFORMULA until he finds it.
column9: OtherSpeak : I don’t need much really.
OtherSpeak : The rare visitors I get here always make me happy.

column1: OtherSpeak : My father was a madman who only dedicated his sad life to the search for NOMTRESOR
OtherSpeak : Do you really think I’ll give that kinda of information to anyone ?
OtherSpeak : Perhaps if you do something for me, I’ll search some of his research
Choice : Fine, If that’s what it takes.
column2: Choice : Nevermind I’ll find it myself
OtherSpeak : Take this with you before you leave!
OtherSpeak : You never know when you'll need a trusty pair of earrings.
OtherSpeak : Maybe you'll you want to wear them?
OtherSpeak : Or offer them to someone you like?
OtherSpeak : I have some, but it comes at a price!
column3: OtherSpeak : I just came back from the market!
column5: OtherSpeak : I always have treats for adventurers stopping by.

column3: OtherSpeak : Take a look in the kitchen.

column1: OtherSpeak : I should be able to cook something nice for you.
OtherSpeak :Unfortunately, I lost my recipe book!
OtherSpeak : Would you be so kind as to bring me one? I’ll make a FEAST if you do !
column5: OtherSpeak : Alright the feast is ready!
column6: OtherSpeak : Sadly, I don’t have anything to offer...

column5: OtherSpeak : Did you like it dear?

column1: Choice : We don’t have any, granny. (leave)
column3: Choice : We don’t have any, old lady. (leave)

column4: OtherSpeak : Oh dear, that's not a recipe book...
column6: Choice : It was terrible! I can cook way better than that and that's saying something!

column2: OtherSpeak : Give me a moment will you? It’ll be ready soon!

column5: OtherSpeak : Wonderful! That makes me so happy!
column6: OtherSpeak : Now you’re hurting my old heart...

column1: OtherSpeak : I come from a very cold place with icy fields.
column2: OtherSpeak : Since my kids left to adventure at sea...
column3: OtherSpeak : Mind your own business, young'un!

column1: OtherSpeak : The warm weather here is much gentler on my old bones...
column2: OtherSpeak : The house never felt so big and empty.
column8: OtherSpeak : To be honest, I’m bored to death here.

column3: Choice : OK… No need to get upset, old goat.
column7: OtherSpeak : There, the only thing people talk about is
column8: OtherSpeak : I would give everything and a bit for a good novel!

column7: OtherSpeak : a legend about a certain NOMTRESOR.

column8: Choice : Here you are, granny, enjoy!
column9: Choice : I don’t have any, sorry...
column10: Choice : I don’t have any, sorry...

column8: OtherSpeak : Oh my, thank you dear!
OtherSpeak : People don’t read enough nowadays.
OtherSpeak : It’s just bandits and pirates everywhere, illiterates brutes!

column1: Narrator : A few bandits are making a mess of the nice furniture.
OtherSpeak : What the hell are you doing here?
column2: Narrator : They haven't noticed CAPITAINE yet.

column1: Narrator : The kitchen is very spacious, clearly a lot of servants used to work here.

column5: PlayerSpeak : The child bedroom is empty…

column1: PlayerSpeak : This must be the attic…

column6: PlayerSpeak : It's only baubles and stuff, but might as well..
